message_1:
Identify the major product(s) of the following rearrangement reaction:

![Rearrangement Reaction](https://i.imgur.com/1q3hzf6.png)

Assume that the reaction takes place under typical conditions for similar reactions, and that all the necessary reagents are present in excess.
message_2:
The given reaction is a Claisen rearrangement, which is a [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement involving an allyl vinyl ether. In this case, the allyl vinyl ether is formed by the reaction of the phenol with the allyl alcohol in the presence of a Lewis acid catalyst.

The Claisen rearrangement proceeds through a concerted mechanism, and the major product is formed by the migration of the allyl group to the more substituted carbon of the vinyl ether, leading to the formation of a more stable carbocation.

The major product of this Claisen rearrangement reaction is:

![Major Product](https://i.imgur.com/5OJH5G0.png)
